instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.5V_S5: What is 5V_S5? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S5” which is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 state. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> goes low when <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> activated.
threads.message:
Originally had liquid damage ages ago, and was repaired.

When I close the lid it boots up, but no backlight until you reboot it. So it's like it knows the lid is closed, but <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is shorting <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> causing it to turn on.

Only way around this is to disconnect battery and boot by connecting a magsafe.

I can't perform an <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> from the keyboard either.

Very confused on this one, any suggestions?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> goes low when <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> activated.
threads.message: The usual, bad Inboard/cable or bad trackpad/cable. Trackpad/cable most likely in this case.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> goes low when <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> activated.
threads.message:
Nothing is plugged in, the board is on the desk.

All jacks look clean.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> goes low when <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> activated.
threads.message:
I noticed the board was maybe greasy, so ultrasonic cleaned it.

Good news, Bad news.
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> doesn't go low with <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> any more, but it won't turn on either And from time to time the charger will swap from orange to green (no battery connected).

Will check power rails now.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> goes low when <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> activated.
threads.message: IO board or flat cable, also check connectors on LB side and IO side...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> goes low when <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> activated.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 22241"]The usual, bad Inboard/cable or bad trackpad/cable. Trackpad/cable most likely in this case.[/QUOTE]

Pulled the TP cable out and it had corrosion all over the TP side.
Your intuition is uncanny at times. :D



MLB & IO Board connectors look good. Used known good IO boards and cables.

The symptoms have changed I need to work out what it is doing and re-diagnose. It seems something is intermittent.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> goes low when <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> activated.
threads.message:
The board is missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>.

I have used multiple known good IO boards and flex cables. Could there be a short pulling it down? Nothing is getting warm.

This board has been a royal PITA.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> goes low when <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> activated.
threads.message:
Why even measure anything else if there is no <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL>??
I suspect crap under SMC, what is PPBUS voltage? <SIGNAL>G2_EN</SIGNAL> even coming on?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> goes low when <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> activated.
threads.message:
Because it used to have <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL>, this only happened after the  ultrasonic clean.

PPBus = 8.17
No <SIGNAL>G2_EN</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> goes low when <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> activated.
threads.message:
Ultrasonic the board for 20minutes then in the oven for an hour.
Book, we got green/orange light and fan spin. Even boots to a flashing folder.

KB/TP issues though, but I knew that from the corrosion.
Caps lock key is always on but no response otherwise.

Can someone confirm the cable number to use for the TP to MLB?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> goes low when <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> activated.
threads.message:
Swapped trackpad and cable and it's operational again.

Please mark solved.
